<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Core capital<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>b</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>)</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> of EUR 16.4 billion, excluding revaluation reserve at the end of Q1 2009 (EUR 7.9 billion including revaluation reserve)
</FONT></B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Statement Alex Wynaendts, CEO </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">&#147;Despite the persistent challenges of the financial crisis, AEGON significantly improved earnings compared to the second half of 2008. Although we posted a net loss in the first quarter, we are encouraged by the improvement in earnings
and the indications that the fundamentals of our business remain sound. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;We continue to focus on freeing up capital from our businesses, reducing
costs, and taking measures to counter the effects of the current environment. Consequently, we released an additional EUR 900&nbsp;million of capital during the first quarter, and made solid progress toward our target of reducing costs by EUR
150&nbsp;million this year. The sale of our life insurance business in Taiwan and the decision to downsize our institutional markets division in the United States are but two examples of our determination to execute on our strategy. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;The relatively stable new life sales and deposits quarter-over-quarter reflect the strength of AEGON&#146;s franchise and the continued confidence of our
customers.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">233</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">186</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="3"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="3"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="3"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Return on equity</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3.3</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">)%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(8.7</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">)%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.2</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">%</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;padding-bottom:6px; margin-top:-3px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>a</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>)</SUP></FONT></I></FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP></SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The calculation of the
IGD (Insurance Group Directive) capital surplus and ratio is based on Solvency I capital requirements on IFRS for entities within the EU (Pillar I for AEGON UK), and local regulatory solvency measurements for non-EU entities. Specifically, required
capital for the life insurance companies in the US is calculated as two times the upper end of the Company Action Level range (200%)&nbsp;as applied by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners in the US </FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><SUP> </SUP></FONT></I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; padding-bottom:8px; margin-top:-2px" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>b</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>)</SUP></FONT></I></FONT></P></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="line-height:95%; vertical-align:top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP></SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Core capital is the sum
of shareholders&#146; equity and the EUR 3 billion in convertible core capital securities from Vereniging AEGON, funded by the Dutch State </FONT></I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Strategic
highlights and short-term priorities </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:0px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Last year, AEGON set out three long-term strategic priorities: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To reallocate capital toward businesses with higher growth and return prospects; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To improve growth and returns from existing businesses; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To manage AEGON as an international company. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsequently AEGON
identified and announced three priorities to counter the challenges of the current global financial crisis and position the company for growth: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Focus on capital preservation and accelerate the capital release program; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">EUR 150&nbsp;million cost savings measures for 2009; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Develop contingency plans for deterioration in financial markets. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As announced last June, AEGON is conducting an ongoing review of its portfolio of businesses to ensure that they meet the criteria outlined in the strategy. On February&nbsp;17, 2009, AEGON announced it will downsize
its institutional spread based business in the Americas, which will result in lower credit risk in the long run and a release of capital in the near term. On April&nbsp;22, 2009, AEGON announced the sale of its life insurance activities in Taiwan.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Capital preservation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the current economic
environment, acceleration of capital preservation actions has been a priority. The actions taken and plans to be executed are evidence of the financial flexibility within AEGON to manage through these extraordinary times. They include: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Releasing EUR 1.7 billion of capital in the second half of 2008; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Commitment to release an additional EUR 1.5 billion of capital in 2009, including EUR 0.3 billion from AEGON&#146;s institutional business. EUR 0.9 billion has been
realized in Q1 2009. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a result of actions taken, the capital position of the company remains strong with excess capital of EUR 2.7
billion over AA capital adequacy requirements at March&nbsp;31, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Cost measures </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON announced cost savings measures totaling EUR 150&nbsp;million in 2009. Actions to achieve this include: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Americas: no wage increases in 2009, staff reductions, deferred hiring, reorganization of agency distribution; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Netherlands: reduction of contract services, process re-engineering, general cost savings; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">United Kingdom: restructuring of IT, marketing and customer services, cost containment and savings in distribution. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON&#146;s cost measures are on track with approximately one third of the total expense savings of 2009 realized across the company in the first quarter of 2009.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Capital management </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Excess capital </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During Q1 2009 financial markets remained challenging. Equity markets showed a negative return, the S&amp;P 500 lost 12% in the quarter, and real estate prices also
continued to decline. Except for some structured asset classes, spreads in many credit market segments, though volatile during the quarter and still at historically high and stressed levels, were tighter or stable when compared to 2008 year-end
levels. Volatilities in equity and bond markets were down from the peaks recorded late 2008, while interest rates gradually increased from historic lows. The negative impact from capital markets on AEGON&#146;s excess capital in Q1 2009 was
estimated at EUR 0.6 billion, primarily from lower equity markets leading to additional minimum guarantee reserve strengthening. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The world economic
outlook for 2009 remains uncertain and most countries are facing a severe recession. Though policymakers continue to respond aggressively to the economic crisis, specifically in the United States where most of AEGON&#146;s credit risk is
concentrated, AEGON expects an elevated level of asset impairments in its investment portfolio in 2009. Impairments negatively impacted AEGON&#146;s capital position in Q1 2009, reducing excess capital by approximately EUR 0.2 billion. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page 2 of 40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, rating agencies have been responding to the economic environment, revising their credit risk
assessments. In Q1 2009, for example, parts of AEGON&#146;s mortgage-related asset portfolio, in particular securities backed by near-prime mortgages referred to as Alt-A and negative amortization/Option ARM floaters, were downgraded to below
investment grade ratings. The rating migration of AEGON&#146;s US portfolio led to higher capital requirements, reducing AEGON&#146;s excess capital by an estimated EUR 0.6 billion for Q1 2009. AEGON considers the rating migration experienced in Q1
2009 as extraordinarily high and expects it not to be repeated to the same extent in coming quarters. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON has preserved capital over the last few
quarters and continues to focus on freeing up capital from its businesses. Part of the EUR 0.9 billion capital preservation in Q1 2009 is related to the decision to reduce investment risk and increase the asset allocation of AEGON&#146;s investment
portfolio to cash, Treasury, government and agency bonds. At the end of Q1 2009, 25% of AEGON&#146;s total general account assets was invested in these asset classes, up from 23% at the end of 2008. The general account of AEGON in the Americas had
an asset allocation of 20% to cash, treasuries and agencies (16% at year-end 2008). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This investment strategy, executed in the last few quarters, has been
successful in a period of widening credit spreads across fixed income markets, and has helped managing the maturity mismatch as a result of institutional spread liabilities getting shorter as puts have been exercised. At the same time, some
structured assets classes have experienced extension of duration. As a result of this investment strategy, AEGON has not been a forced seller of assets at depressed prices. This strategy has preserved value, even though currently the return on
short-dated and government investments is lower. Going forward, AEGON will continue to manage its credit portfolio actively. However, with current market conditions and the maturity of assets and liabilities of institutional spread business closer
aligned now, AEGON will start to put part of the new money inflows into highly rated credit investments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the end of Q1 2009, AEGON had EUR 2.7 billion
excess capital over AA capital adequacy requirements, down from EUR 2.9 billion at the end of 2008. The positive impacts from capital preservation actions and statutory earnings were mitigated by rating migration, impairments and lower equity
markets on required and available capital. At the end of Q1 2009, AEGON had an IGD solvency ratio of approximately 170% (Q4 2008: 183%). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>IFRS core
capital </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the end of March 2009, core capital excluding the revaluation account was EUR 16.4 billion, 77% of the total capital base, well above the
minimum target of 70%. Core capital including revaluation reserve was EUR 7.9 billion, consisting of EUR 4.9 billion of shareholders&#146; equity and EUR 3 billion of convertible core capital securities provided by Vereniging AEGON, funded by the
Dutch State. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON&#146;s revaluation account decreased during Q1 2009 by EUR 1.4 billion to a negative EUR 8.5 billion. The lower revaluation account was
the main driver of the decline in shareholders&#146; equity. The revaluation account was down primarily due to the impact of higher risk free long-term interest rates on bond values. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;3&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Financial
highlights </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(41</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;4&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Operational
highlights </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Overview </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON
reported a net loss for Q1 2009 of EUR 173&nbsp;million, a reversal of the downward trend in net income in the second half of 2008. The loss in Q1 2009 was the result primarily of the impact of lower equity markets, underperformance of fair value
items and impairment charges. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Underlying earnings before tax of minus EUR 22&nbsp;million were down mainly due to lower financial markets compared to the
same quarter last year, but improved substantially compared to Q4 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fair value items, which primarily include certain investment classes in the
Netherlands and the Americas, as well as a number of products containing financial guarantees, contributed a negative EUR 197&nbsp;million to earnings in Q1 2009, a strong improvement compared to recent quarters. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Net income was also negatively impacted by impairment charges (EUR 386 million). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Gains on investments totaled EUR 173&nbsp;million, largely due to gains on shares and bonds in the Netherlands. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The underlying loss in Q1 2009,
as well as impairments and mark-to-market losses on the fair value items, resulted in a tax benefit of EUR 282 million. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Underlying earnings before tax
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In Q1 2009 the underlying loss for the company amounted to EUR 22 million. Excluding the impact from capital markets the earnings were approximately
EUR 450 million. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The underlying loss in the Americas was USD 88 million. Lower equity markets led to minimum guarantee reserves strengthening and
accelerated amortization of deferred policy acquisition costs (DPAC), primarily affecting earnings in the variable annuity and life reinsurance business. The total impact on earnings from lower equity markets amounted to approximately USD
600&nbsp;million, which also includes lower fee income due to reduced asset balances. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Underlying earnings in the Americas in Q1 2009 were also affected by
the decisions to lower the allocation to hedge funds and increase the asset allocation to cash, treasury and agency bonds, in order to preserve capital. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">In the Netherlands, underlying earnings were down 36% to EUR 72&nbsp;million, a result of lower technical results in the life and pension business and adverse claims experience in general insurance. Also, investment income declined across
most businesses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Underlying earnings in the United Kingdom, meanwhile, totaled GBP 7&nbsp;million, lower than last year, due primarily to the impact of
lower equity and corporate bond markets on fund related charges in the pension business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Underlying earnings from Other countries amounted to EUR
30&nbsp;million, lower than last year, as a result of higher losses in Taiwan and currency depreciation in Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Net
income </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Net income included a total underperformance result on fair value items of EUR 197 million. Fair value items primarily include certain
(alternative) investment classes in the Netherlands and the Americas, as well as a number of products containing financial guarantees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In Q1 2009,
underperformance of alternative investment classes in the Americas, in particular real estate as well as private equity and credit derivatives amounted to EUR 163 million. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fair value items also include the under/overperformance on assets held at fair value through profit or loss and backing liabilities of a specific portfolio of group pension contracts in the Netherlands. In Q1 2009
these assets underperformed long-term expected returns by EUR 54 million. The assets backing this portfolio of liabilities were accounted for as fair value through profit or loss and have been replaced with assets accounted for as available for sale
as per Q2 2009. As a result this item will not recur as fair value item going forward. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to maintain consistency in definitions, starting in Q4
2008, the net impact of the fair value movements of guarantees and the related hedges in the Netherlands has been included in fair value items. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;5&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Previously, differences in fair value between guarantees and related hedges, referred to as hedge ineffectiveness,
were reported in gains/losses on investments. Results for prior years have been adjusted (see Financial Supplement). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Net fair value gains of EUR
132&nbsp;million on GMWB guarantees and related hedges in the Americas were offset by the negative impact of EUR 135&nbsp;million from hedge ineffectiveness in the Netherlands. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The fair valuation of certain products with guarantees includes a credit spread in the discount rates, a reflection of dislocated, volatile and illiquid markets. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Gains on investments </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Gains on investments of EUR 173&nbsp;million
include primarily gains on sales of bonds in the Netherlands and in the United Kingdom, the sales of shares in the Netherlands and positive results from economic hedges at holding level. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Impairment charges </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Impairments of EUR 386&nbsp;million included EUR 133&nbsp;million on subprime mortgage asset
backed securities and EUR 72&nbsp;million on residential mortgage backed securities, both in the Americas. The remainder of impairments in the Americas was mainly related to corporate bonds. Impairments in the Netherlands were taken on equity and
bonds. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Tax </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The underlying loss in Q1 2009, as well as
impairments and mark-to-market losses on the fair value items, resulted in a tax benefit of EUR 282 million. The high effective tax rate is mainly a result of tax credits and other permanent differences. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Commissions and expenses </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Compared to Q4 2008 commissions and
expenses decreased by 13% to EUR 1.6 billion. Operating expenses were down 9% to EUR 842&nbsp;million as a result of cost savings, partly offset by restructuring charges and higher employee pension costs. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Compared to Q1 2008 commissions and expenses increased by 14% (8% at constant currency), primarily due to acceleration of DPAC amortization. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Operating expenses increased by 8% (4% at constant currency) compared to Q1 2008. An increase in employee benefit pension expenses and restructuring expenses in several
businesses offset expense savings from cost savings programs. Operating expenses also increased as a result of acquisitions in Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe in 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Sales </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total new life sales in Q1 2009 were down 9% compared to Q4 2008, and decreased by 15% (at constant currency)
to EUR 543&nbsp;million compared to Q1 2008. With the exception of Spain, all countries recorded lower sales compared to Q1 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">New life sales in the
Americas were down 11% compared to Q4 2008 and 31% compared to Q1 2008 in local currency, due to lower universal life sales in the high net worth and variable life sales in the middle market as well as lower sales of bank-owned and corporate-owned
life insurance (BOLI/COLI) contracts. Life reinsurance sales were down as well compared to last year, but were in line with previous quarters. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the
Netherlands new life sales were up 51% compared to Q4 2008, primarily due to a strong increase in group pension sales, which included several large contracts. Sales were down 13% compared to Q1 2008, a result primarily of lower individual life
sales. Q1 2009 group pension sales were in line with last year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">New life sales in the United Kingdom in the first quarter of the year were down 9%
compared to both Q1 2008 and Q4 2008. Sales were down across most lines of business offsetting growth in annuities. In Q1 2008 new life sales in the UK included European variable annuities, which are now reported in Other countries. Including the
sales of variable annuities in the UK in Q1 2009, the new life sales declined with 6% compared to Q1 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In Other countries new life sales in Q1 2009
were down 14% compared to Q4 2008 and down 11% compared to Q1 2008. New life sales in Spain rose to EUR 22&nbsp;million, a reflection mainly of the incorporation of two new joint ventures, as well as higher sales at existing joint ventures.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;6&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">95,963</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>2</I></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>&nbsp;</I></FONT></TD>

 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;7&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Sales through Caja de Ahorros del Mediterran&eacute;o (CAM), AEGON&#146;s largest bank partner in Spain, which is an
associate and therefore not consolidated, more than tripled to EUR 66&nbsp;million (on a 100% basis) in Q1 2009, mainly due to higher sales of recurring premium risk products and sales of pension products following changes in pension legislation.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe, new life sales totaled EUR 16&nbsp;million, down 24% (18% at constant currency) compared to Q1 2008. Single premium
sales in Poland were lower due to a decline in equity markets. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In Asia, new life sales decreased to EUR 12&nbsp;million as increased sales in China were
more than offset by a decline in Taiwan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Deposits </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Total gross deposits excluding institutional guaranteed products were up 19% to EUR 6.4 billion. Total gross on and off balance deposits for the company decreased by 5% (down 15% in constant currency) to EUR 8.2 billion in Q1 2009. The main
driver for the decline was the significantly lower sales of both institutional spread and institutional fee business in the Americas. AEGON recently announced its decision to downsize its institutional spread based business. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fixed annuities sales in the Americas continued to be strong. AEGON continues to expect these sales to decrease during the remainder of the year. Variable annuity sales
in the Americas were in line with sales in the last few quarters. Sales of retirement plans in the pension business were strong, particularly when taking into account the impact of lower financial markets on the balances taken over. Managed assets
and retail mutual fund sales were down as a result of the turmoil in financial markets. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Gross deposits in Other countries tripled to EUR 706 million.
Gross deposits in Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe were up 11% in constant currency. Despite the adverse economic environment, pension deposits continue to be strong, reflecting growth of the business as well as the incorporation of acquisitions.
Deposits in Asia totaled EUR 405&nbsp;million, a result of the inclusion of the asset management joint venture in China. In Q1 2009 deposits in Other countries also included sales of European variable annuities for the first time which amounted to
EUR 111 million. A variable annuity product was introduced in France through AEGON&#146;s partner La Mondiale. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Net deposits amounted to approximately EUR
1.1 billion, excluding institutional guaranteed products. Net deposits for the company amounted to a negative EUR 1.3 billion as a result of outflows in the institutional business in the Americas, following the decision to downsize that business.
This effect offset net inflows in fixed annuities and the pension business in the Americas and CEE, as well as net inflows in AEGON&#146;s asset management joint venture in China. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Value of new business </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The value of new business (VNB) for the company was up 8% compared to Q1 2008. VNB was up due
to increases in Spain and the Netherlands. The internal rate of return is 17.8%, slightly lower than last year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;8&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Americas
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Underlying loss of USD 88 million; USD 600&nbsp;million impact from decline in equity markets </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Negative contribution of fair value items of USD 42&nbsp;million on lower real estate values offset by positive impact from fair value GMWB guarantees and
related hedges </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Impairments of USD 370&nbsp;million </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Strong sales of fixed annuities and retirement plan sales; net deposits USD 1.6 billion (excl. institutional guaranteed products)
</B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Overview </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The decline in equity
markets in Q1 2009 had a significant impact (approx. USD 600 million), on underlying earnings in the Americas and led to lower fee income in many of the businesses, and reserve strengthening and accelerated amortization of deferred policy
acquisition costs in the variable annuities business. In addition, earnings were affected by the decision to reduce exposure to hedge fund investments while increasing the asset allocation to cash, treasury and agency bonds. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Results in the Americas also included USD 370&nbsp;million of post DPAC impairments. The impairments pre DPAC were USD 427&nbsp;million, of which the majority (USD 267
million) was related to structured asset impairments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Sales of fixed annuities continued to be strong during the quarter. AEGON continues to expect these
sales to decrease during the remainder of the year. Sales of variable annuities were consistent with sales in the last few quarters. New life sales were down in all lines of business. Sales of retirement plans in the pension business were strong,
particularly when taking into account the impact of lower financial markets on the balances taken over. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Value of new business was down 13%, reflecting
reduced institutional sales, and lower VNB of life and protection, but higher VNB from fixed annuities and pensions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Underlying earnings before tax
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON reported an underlying loss before tax in the Americas for Q1 2009 of USD 88 million: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Earnings from Life&nbsp;&amp; Protection declined 19% compared to Q1 2008 to USD 221&nbsp;million, and include an USD 25&nbsp;million persistency related charge
following the decline in equity markets this quarter. Earnings also include USD 26&nbsp;million of increased employee pension expenses. In Q1 2008 underlying earnings included exceptional unfavorable mortality charges of USD 34 million;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Individual Savings&nbsp;&amp; Retirement earnings came in at a loss of USD 403&nbsp;million, due to the equity market impact on fee income, minimum guarantee
reserve strengthening and accelerated DPAC amortization (in total USD 460 million). In addition, changes in lapse assumptions affected earnings by USD 75 million; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pensions&nbsp;&amp; Asset Management earnings decreased to USD 10&nbsp;million, a result primarily of lower fees from reduced asset balances;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Earnings from the Institutional business were down 28% to USD 117 million. A decrease in short-term rates continued to produce more positive spreads on
institutional guaranteed products, offset, however, by spread compression from the higher asset allocation to cash and restructuring costs following the decision to downsize the institutional business; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the Life Reinsurance business the underlying loss amounted to USD 30&nbsp;million, including a USD 40&nbsp;million impact from lower equity markets and
unfavorable mortality (USD 26 million). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Net income </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON reported a net loss for Q1 of USD 173&nbsp;million in the Americas. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fair value items showed an underperformance of
USD 42&nbsp;million, a result primarily of underperformance of alternative assets like real estate partnerships, as well as private equity, and lower market values of credit derivatives. These were offset by the positive impact of higher interest
rates on the fair value of GMWB guarantees and positive result on GMWB related hedges. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Results in the Americas also included USD 370&nbsp;million of post
DPAC impairments. The impairments pre DPAC were USD 427&nbsp;million, of which the majority (USD 267 million) was related to structured asset impairments, including securities backed by subprime mortgages (USD 173 million). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;10&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The high effective tax rate is mainly a result of the tax benefits for permanent differences and tax credits which
increase the effective tax rate in the current overall pre-tax loss situation. In addition, pre-tax earnings from Ireland being taxed at their lower rate also resulted in an increase in the effective tax rate in the current overall pre-tax loss
situation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Commissions and expenses </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total commissions
and expenses increased 12% in Q1, primarily due to acceleration of DPAC amortization. Q1 operating expenses were up 3%. An increase in employee pension plan costs (USD 43 million) as well as restructuring expenses, primarily related to the
downsizing of institutional business (USD 22 million), offset the positive contributions of cost initiatives. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Sales and deposits </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total new life sales in the Americas were down 31% in the quarter, driven primarily by a decline in universal life sales in the high net worth market and variable life
sales in the middle market. Retail life sales were in line with Q4 2008. The BOLI/COLI market has declined significantly as a result of the financial crisis and its impact on banks. Life reinsurance sales were down as well compared to last year, but
were in line with previous quarters. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total gross deposits, excluding institutional guaranteed products, were in line with Q1 2008 and increased by 2%
compared to Q4 2008. Net deposits excluding institutional guaranteed products were up significantly to USD 1.6 billion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fixed annuities sales came in
strong again after several quarters of growth. AEGON continues to expect these sales to decrease during the remainder of the year. Variable annuity sales were in line with sales in the last few quarters, while retail mutual fund sales suffered from
lower financial markets as expected. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Sales of retirement plans in the pension business were strong, particularly when taking into account the impact of
lower financial markets on the balances taken over. Managed assets clearly declined also because of financial market turmoil. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Sales of institutional
guaranteed products are low, after the decision to downsize the institutional spread based business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Sales of accident and health products were in line
with sales over the last few quarters. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Value of new business </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">The value of new business (VNB) in the Americas amounted to USD 103&nbsp;million, and the internal rate of return (IRR) was 10.3%. Declines in VNB and IRR were noticeable in the retail life business due to lower production and lower
investment return assumptions. VNB in the institutional business was down due to the discontinuance of new sales. The VNB and IRR in the variable annuity business were negatively affected by hedge costs. VNB was up significantly for fixed annuities
on higher production while VNB for the pension and reinsurance businesses were in line with the prior year. Please refer to page 29 for more detailed information on VNB. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Revenue generating investments </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AEGON&#146;s total revenue generating investments at the end of March 2009 totaled
USD 279 billion, down 2% from three months earlier. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>

knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Fixed annuities</I></FONT></P></TD>

<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>)</I></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Variable annuities</I></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="center" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(1)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>&nbsp;</I></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>For the amounts in euro see the Financial Supplement. </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local
knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page&nbsp;13&nbsp;of&nbsp;40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Netherlands
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Underlying earnings declined 36% to EUR 72&nbsp;million </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Life sales down 13%, due to decline in retail market; group pension sales were strong </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><B></B></FONT></FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Value of new business of EUR 31 million; internal rate of return of 14.1% </B></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Overview </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Netherlands reported a net loss in Q1 2009 of EUR 41 million. Underlying earnings were down 36%, a
result of lower technical results in the life and pension business and adverse claims experience in general insurance. Also, investment income declined across most businesses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fair value items underperformed long-term expectations, a result mainly from differences in fair value between guarantees and related hedges, referenced as hedge ineffectiveness. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Impairments, primarily on equity investments, totaled EUR 78&nbsp;million, while investment gains from the sale of bonds and shares amounted to EUR 110 million.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Underlying earnings before tax </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Life business reported earnings of EUR 44&nbsp;million, up from last year on higher investment income offset by lower technical results.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In Accident and Health underlying earnings were EUR 11&nbsp;million, an increase of EUR 3&nbsp;million, mainly a result of a technical provision release.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Savings business reported a loss of EUR 9&nbsp;million, due to pressure on margins and volumes from fierce competition in the savings market.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Earnings from Pensions&nbsp;&amp; Asset Management amounted to EUR 26&nbsp;million down from Q1 2008, primarily the result of lower investment income.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Earnings from Distribution amounted to EUR 9&nbsp;million, below last year&#146;s result due to the slowdown in the real estate market.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS">&#161;</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"></FONT></SUP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"></FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">General insurance earnings were down significantly to a loss of EUR 9&nbsp;million, due mainly to higher claims experience. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Net income </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Fair value items include the under/overperformance on
assets held at fair value through profit and loss, backing liabilities of a specific portfolio of group pension contracts held in the general account. In Q1 2009 these assets underperformed long-term expected returns by EUR 54 million. The assets
backing this portfolio of liabilities were accounted for as fair value through profit or loss and have been replaced with assets accounted for as available for sale as per Q2 2009. As a result this item will not recur as fair value item going
forward. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Also, in order to maintain consistency in definitions, starting in Q4 2008, the net impact of the fair value movements of guarantees and the
related hedges has been included in fair value items. Previously, differences in fair value between guarantees and related hedges, referenced as hedge ineffectiveness, were reported in gains/losses on investments. Earnings in Q1 2009 include a EUR
135&nbsp;million negative impact from hedge ineffectiveness. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Impairments of EUR 78&nbsp;million were primarily related to equity investments and corporate
credit investments. Investment gains amounted to EUR 110&nbsp;million and include gains on bonds and shares sold during the quarter. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The positive
contribution from tax is due to tax deductable impairments and losses on fair value items, as well as tax exempt income. The high effective tax rate is mainly a result of the tax exempt items which increase the effective tax rate in the current
overall pre-tax loss situation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Commissions and expenses </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Commissions and expenses were down 1% and operating expenses decreased also by 1%. Higher expenses for employee benefits were offset by lower project related expenses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Sales and deposits </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pension sales were in line with last year due to several large contracts sold during the quarter.
Renewal rates in the pension business continued to improve. Sales of both single and regular premium individual life products were down compared to last year, following increased pricing competition in the immediate annuity market, as well as lower
demand for regular premium products. Sales in accident&nbsp;&amp; health were up as a result of higher sales of alternative disability products to WIA product. Sales of general insurance products were down on last year due to the competitive market.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:3px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px dotted #000000; padding-left:8px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Local knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Page 14 of 40</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Gross deposits were down by 15% compared with Q1 2008, due to fierce competition. Net deposits in the savings
business improved significantly compared to Q4 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Value of new business </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The value of new business (VNB) increased to EUR 31&nbsp;million and the internal rate of return improved to 14.1%, primarily as a result of a margin improvement in the mortgage business. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Please refer to page 29 for more detailed information on VNB. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Revenue
generating investments </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the end of March 2009, revenue generating investments totaled EUR 63.4 billion; in line with December 2008 levels.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="line-height:1px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>

knowledge. Global power.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P></TD>

<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">40</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>38</I></FONT></TD>
